Summary: Small white ball of light floating across the sky
trends: There have been 221 other sightings in Chicago
There were no other sightings in Chicago on or around August 20th 2005
divs: sighting detailsi was outside at night, with 9 friends and family, ages 18-55, around a pit fire when i noticed a small white ball of light floating across the sky. at first i thought it was a white balloon, so i disregarded it, until i saw a second one follow it, about 5-10 seconds apart. it was in same shape, appearance, and speed as the first one. then there appeared a third object, same as the first two. it had a smaller pinpoint of light trailing it and then another white ball of light closely following it. there were 30+ objects seen over a span of twenty minutes. the intervals of seperation were anywhere from several seconds to a minute. they all traveled in the same direction across the same path in the sky.the lights were traveling from northwest to southeast and seemed to be at high altitude. there was a full moon out and a clear sky. the lights were not planes because there were planes in the area at the same time as the lights, which had no flashing lights on them. in fact, one of the lights actually crossed the path of a plane, the object flying over it. one of the objects that flew by halfway through the event appeared lower in altitude or bigger in size because it was observed to be rotating as it flew through the sky. there was a black spot that could be seen on it. the area in which the objects flew is residential and very well lit with street lighting and the sky has the soft glow of the city of chicago lights illuminating it. there was no mistaking the lights for planes, helicopters, balloons, or any thing else except for silent, fast moving white lights. the police were contacted but a cruiser came about five mins. after the last light flew by so no official sighting was taken. there was an air and water show earlier that day on the chicago lakefront the cop told us, so he said the craft might have been military. however, the lights were seen flying extremely close to commercial airliners (our area is in a holding pattern for chicago midway airport) and the nighttime nature of the event left his explanation suspect. we tried recording the lights with a camcorder, but they could not be see through the view finder. through binoculars, the lights appeared to be triangular\oblong shaped, except for the large one seen; it had a pear\dumbbell shape. we lost sight of the objetc because of trees. if there was any other report of this sighting, could you please let me know.
